page.title: 12Education in the Hurn area.
page.content: The village school at Holbeach Hurn,St.Lukes,was closed in 1967.Primary school children are now taken by bus to Holbeach Bank school 3 miles away.Some go to Holbeach St.Marks,Fleet Wood Lane or Holbeach but they are not entitled to free transport.At 11,depending on 11+ results,children transfer to the George Farmer secondary modern school in Holbeach,or the Boy's Grammar school or Girl's High school in Spalding.Free transport is provided for these children.For the under 5's there is a playgroup in the village hall(the old primary school) on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays.This began in 1970.In July 1985 there were 25 children on roll.The cost is 50p per session and the playgroup leader is Mrs. Hazel Blyth.
